results.title: Get rid of rats
results.brief_description: Rats are the destroyers of millions of dollars worth of food each year, as well as carriers of dangerous diseases against which scientists war constantly. The city dump, breeding and feeding ground from which the rats spread through towns and villages, must be replaced with modern garbage disposal techniques. The rat-proofing of cellars and storage buildings must be done with intelligence and common sense to match rat strength and cunning. Only by depriving them of food and shelter can man eliminate these filthy disease-carriers.

results.title: Get real
results.creator_credit: Stephen Taylor, Distant Horizons, Graphite Film Production, Paramount Pictures and Simon Shore
results.brief_description: Steven Carter (Ben Silverstone) is in his final year of high school. Apart from the normal pains of adolescence - taunting from the school jocks, an unsympathetic father, the pressure of school and exams - Steven is also looking forward to the day he can be open about his homosexuality. One day after school, while visiting one of the local “beats”, Steven is propositioned by school’s star athlete John (Brad Gorton). From fumbling and clumsy beginnings the two young men begin a tender affair but it is a relationship that John refuses to make public. Steven finds himself caught between his desire to be honest to his friends and family and his knowledge that “coming out” will place his relationship with John at risk. “Get Real” is an entertaining story about teenage sexuality and teenage friendships, humorously examining homosexual and heterosexual courtship rites with tenderness and delicacy. A talented young cast assist in making this a joyful and optimistic film about youth. Based on the play “What’s Wrong With Angry?” by Patrick Wilde, who also wrote the script.

results.title: Get out your handkerchiefs = Preparez vos mouchoirs
results.creator_credit: Interama, George Dancigers, Alexande Minouchkine, Paul Claudon and Bertrand Blier
results.brief_description: Gerard Depardieu is Raoul, a young working-class man devoted to his wife, Solange, played by Carole Laure. Convinced that Solange has tired of him, he convinces a stranger, Stephan (Patrick Dewaere), to enter a menage-a-trois with himself and Solange. However, no matter how hard they try, no matter how much love they offer Solange, they are unable to bring a smile to her face or make her fall pregnant (which they believe is all that she really needs). A trip away to a summer camp leads to Solange meeting the precocious Christian, a thirteen year old boy with the IQ of a genius. At first, she attempts to mother the boy, but finds herself slowly seduced by him, and Stephan and Raoul can only stand-by and watch as the teenager gives Solange everything they cannot. This wickedly sly comedy about marriage, sexual mores, and the differences between men and women won the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language film in 1978. Though definitely absurdist in its sensibility, “Get Out Your Handkerchiefs” refuses to treat its characters cynically or cruelly. Rather, it is as if in examining the fall-out of the sexual revolution, Blier’s response is to throw up his arms, laugh at the madness of it all, and finally to celebrate the madness of the battle of the sexes. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Get it write
results.brief_description: A guide to writing essays, reports and projects. Emphasizes the importance of a suitable approach to the topic; careful thought and research; a step by step method of writing; and the development of logical argument.

results.title: Get it together
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Herman S. Saunders and Richard Miner
results.brief_description: Tells the true story of a young man who became a paraplegic as a result of a auto accident. Shows how he returned to college, married and began a career as a recreational therapist.

results.title: Get help - give aid
results.creator_credit: Fillinger Films, American College of Emergency Physicians and Paul Fillinger
results.brief_description: Gives us an overview of what first aid to provide in a variety of emergency situations. Shows how to use the phone to contact emergency services; how to stop the flow of blood; how to give mouth-to-mouth resuscitation; how to help a person whose clothes are on fire and how to give aid to a person who is choking. NB THE PROCEDURE FOR FIRST AID FOR CHOKING IS NOT THE PROCEDURE RECOMMENDED IN AUSTRALIA.

results.title: Get heelers they said it will be fun they said...
results.material_description: Digital screen recording from @sandrastevenjenkins20's Tiktok feed
results.brief_description: Covid Lockdowns prompted many people to get a puppy - but not everyone was ready for the energy bomb of a heeler in their life! This is one of countless social media videos showing footage of heeler puppies chewing, biting, fighting and wriggling their way into the lives of their new humans.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Covid-19 lockdowns prompted many people to get a puppy – but not everyone was ready for the energy bomb of a heeler in their life! This viral video uses the phrasal meme template “X, they said”, which allows people to substitute the X (in this case, heeler puppies) with whatever supposedly fun or simple situation happens to backfire on them. As Know Your Meme outlines, this meme template originated in Warcraft 2 with footmen who would say, “‘Join the army!’, they said. ‘See the world!’, they said… I’d rather be sailing.”
description_for_label: Covid-19 lockdowns prompted many people to get a puppy – but not everyone was ready for the energy bomb of a heeler in their life! This viral video uses a phrasal meme template “X, they said”, which allows people to substitute the X (in this case, heeler puppies) with whatever supposedly fun and simple situation that happens to backfire on them. It originated in Warcraft 2 with footmen who would say, “‘Join the army!’ they said. ‘See the world!’ they said… I’d rather be sailing.”

results.title: Get Carter
results.creator_credit: Michael Klinger, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Mike Hodges
results.brief_description: Professional gangster Jack Carter (Michael Caine) returns to his old hometown of Newcastle to attend the funeral of his brother. Refusing to accept that his death was suicide, he seeks out his brother’s underworld contacts who are less than helpful and suggest he returns to London. His determination to pursue his brother’s killers leads him on a trail through the corrupt and seedy local underworld of prostitution, pornography and crime boss rivalries, as attempts are made on his life. A landmark performance by Michael Caine as a calculating and vicious criminal bent on revenge, who shows his victims no mercy. This grim and violent British film noir thriller is set in the bleak landscape of a wintry Northern industrial city and is the debut film from director Mike Hodges. Based on the Ted Lewis novel “Jack returns”, the cast also includes Ian Hendry, John Osborne and Britt Ekland. Additional features include an international trailer, introduction to the film by Michael Caine, and footage of Roy Budd playing the haunting opening theme.

results.title: Get a job
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Derek Mazur, Michael Scott and Brad Caslor
results.brief_description: An animated short film that follows the tribulations of a cartoon character, Bob Dog, as he hunts for a job. Self-motivation, preparing a resume, contacting people by phone and mail, getting ready for an interview and the interview itself—all are dealt with in a highly entertaining fashion. The Motown mover Get a Job provides the upbeat musical sound track.
